snippet: In a chaotic exodus, tens of thousands of Cambodians have left the country, apparently driven by fears of a crackdown on illegal laborers by the military junta that seized power last month.
abstract: Tens of thousands of Cambodian workers flee Thailand, driven by fears of crackdown on illegal foreign labor by military junta that took power in May; exodus threatens to strain relationship between countries and is harmful to both Cambodian workers and Thai industry.

byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Aranyaprathet, Thailand.

lead_paragraph: In a chaotic exodus, tens of thousands of Cambodians have left the country, apparently driven by fears of a crackdown on illegal laborers by the military junta that seized power last month.

headline.main: Fearing a Junta Crackdown, Cambodian Workers Stream Out of Thailand
headline.print_headline: Fearing a Junta Crackdown, Cambodian Workers Stream Out of Thailand
